Administration.text:
Type:
Anticoagulant
, Factor Xa Inhibitor
Dosage Forms: 10mg, 15mg, 20mg
Routes of Administration:
Common Trade Names: Xarelto

DVT_Prophylaxis.text: 10mg PO QD x35 days; Start: 6-10h post-op once hemostasis established

DVT/PE_Treatment.text:
15mg twice daily x 21 days if CrCl ≥15
[1]
20mg once daily starting day 22 if CrCl ≥15

Atrial_fibrillation_and_new_stent.text:
Rivaroxaban 15 mg/day plus
clopidogrel
for 12 months post-stenting just as efficacious to current standard
Reduces clinically significant bleeds from ~27% to 17% as compared to
warfarin
plus DAPT

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 5-9 hours
Metabolism: CYP450
Excretion: 66% Urine, 28% Feces

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Inhibits platelet activation and fibrin clot formation via direct, selective and reversible inhibition of factor Xa in both the intrinsic and extrinsic coagulation pathways
